author: Reginald H. Henderson

review: Apple always make the best products, don't they? I love the Apple TV because it is very smooth and fast. I use a device called Boxee to view my own files on my projector, and compared to the Apple TV, it is too slow and laggy. I love the Airplay on the Apple TV. The only thing that separates the Apple TV from perfection is its inability to stream local files. Sure you can stream your iTunes collection, but what about my Avi's and MKV's?

review: It's a great buy, I'm very happy about it. I'm thinking buying another one for my other TV. Highly recommend.
author: Michael H Pan

review: This was my third AppleTV, and it keeps getting better, all for 99 bucks. My home is an Apple world, and the AppleTV ties it all together seamlessly into my living room, and now in any other room since I have two others. I love being able to play my music, movies, Pandora, the new iTunes Radio, Netflix, YouTube, etc. all right on my home theater system and control it all from my iPhone or iPad. The ability to browse something on my iPhone or iPad and quickly throw it up to my home theater via AirPlay is just awesome.  My only beef is the lack of analog audio outputs that I had on my First Generation AppleTV. Almost all Zone 2 outputs on home theater receivers require analog instead of digital, so I find myself unable to play iTunes or Pandora through the AppleTV to my outdoor speakers. Other than that, I love this device. It sets up quickly and just plain works great.
author: M. Goyette

review: Like so many of Apple's products, this seems to come with many maddening singularities.  It required weeks of tinkering to get sound from Netflix, for example.  I still haven't figure out if or how I can watch videos on my computer without first loading them into iTunes, and, of course, my Kindle videos seem to be out of bounds as well.  I am not a "tekkie," so maybe these betray my own incompetence, but...you know what...I don't like buying hassles, which on balance this is.  I see some but not much net gain.
author: Tom Diaz
